attributes.action: Reduce overall taxation and make good the apparent loss by making the public sector more efficient
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Assume the average UK salary is £25,000

Tax is charged at 22%, which costs £5,500.

National Insurance is charged at 10%, which costs £2,500

Assume that the average car does 30 mpg, the average mileage is 12,000 per year - i.e. 400 gallons of fuel per year.

400 gallons @ £5 each is £2,000, of which £1,600 (or thereabouts) is tax.

£5,500 + £2,500 + £1,600 = £9,600

£9,600 is approx 38% of £25,000.

Leaving aside the fact that the £1,600 fuel tax is from net pay, the effective tax rate is at least 38%.

(Granted, the calculation does ignore the 0% and 10% bands - but, in fairness, it also ignores council tax).

We the undersigned say "enough already; stop increasing our taxes; make the public sector more efficient so it no longer requires endless increases in our taxes to pay for it"
